definition: to turn over/to flip over/to overturn/to rummage through/to translate/to decode/to double/to climb over or into/to cross

white/snowy/pure/bright/empty/blank/plain/clear/to make clear/in vain/gratuitous/free of charge/reactionary/anti-communist/funeral/to stare coldly/to write wrong character/to state/to explain/vernacular/spoken lines in opera
eye/small hole/crux (of a matter)/CL:隻|只[zhi1],雙|双[shuang1]/classifier for big hollow things (wells, stoves, pots etc)

sentences.english: See a 69 at the end, and you’re guaranteed to roll your eyes.
sentences.chinese: 從頭到尾都是6和9，我保證你會翻白眼。

sentences.english: And no eye-rolling, Dr. Gutting said.

sentences.chinese: 聽到這你就翻白眼了，對嗎？

sentences.english: Students should never smack their lips, roll theirs eyes, or show disrespect with gestures.
sentences.chinese: 孩子不能做咂嘴，翻白眼或者其他不尊重他人的舉動。

sentences.english: He showed the whites of his eyes and seemed to have ceased breathing.
sentences.chinese: 他翻白眼，似乎已經停止了呼吸。

sentences.english: Cat lovers and the pet averse will just roll their eyes at such dogophilia.
sentences.chinese: 愛貓者和厭惡寵物者對這種親狗症只能翻翻白眼而已。

sentences.english: Night gives you a black eye, but you use it rolling his eyes.
sentences.chinese: 黑夜給了你黑色的眼睛，你卻用它翻白眼。

definition: to give a supercilious look/roll of the eyes
to open one's eyes wide/to stare/to glare (at sb)/to scowl
to curl one's lip/to twitch one's mouth
to be angry about sth but also find it laughable
variant of 憤憤|愤愤[fen4 fen4]
